newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - McDonald's off, Dell up.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - McDonald's off, Dell up.

text.p: Investors unloaded McDonald's Corp and Wendy's International Inc shares before Wednesday's U.S. market open on reports of an imminent fast-food price war expected, traders said.
In third market trade preceding the opening bell, McDonald's shares fell to 44-1/2 from 47-3/8 and Wendy's declined 2-1/4 to 20.
The Wall Street Journal reported that McDonald's, in an effort to lift flagging sales, will cut the price of a Big Mac to $0.55 from $1.90 with the purchase of french fries and a beverage.
The NYSE-listed American Depositary Receipts of Grand Metropolitan, parent of Burger King, made no moves before the open, though the London-traded shares were off 13-1/2 pence to 463 pence.
Elsewhere, Dell Computer Corp rose two to 74-1/8, extending gains that began last night with the company's announcement of stronger-than-expected fourth quarter results.
The computer maker said after Tuesday's market close it earned $1.01 per share, beyond the $0.83 per share First Call analysts' consensus forecast.
ClinTrials Research Inc share rebounded partially, rising to 10-1/4 from 9-1/2 before the open.
Yesterday, the shares tumbled 13-3/4 after divulging it expects first quarter income to be about $0.04 per share, down from $0.08 in the year-ago period.

Among other stocks active in pre-open trade, Cisco Systems rose to 57-3/4 from 56-1/2, Novell Inc added 1/4 to 12-3/4, Intel traded in line at 148-7/8, Microsoft edged 1/8 higher to 99-5/8 and Cascade Communications Corp surrendered 1-1/2 to 32-1/2.
Also, Octel climbed to 18 from 16-3/4 and VLSI Technology was up 3/4 to 19-1/8.
